page.title: 04THE YEAR OF A ROSE QUEEN.
page.content: At St. Elizabeths Church Sunday ch we choose a Rose Queen each year. This year has been my turn. I was crowned in August 1984 at the church gard. My dress was white satin with lace top and blue bows on the skirt. I hroyal blue velvet cloak with fur round ge. Before I was crowned I wore a tiara. I had seven attendants and I bougll a present. When I had been crowned I had to make a speech. During the year I have visited other queens and taken part in carnivals and processions.In March I held a Queens At Home at Aspull High School. About 150 people attended and a sum of money was raised.This money went towards the church funds. My name is Ruth Atherton, and this has been an enjoyable year I shall always remember.
